thread.title: Could this be the MOST beautiful part of Britain?
thread.title_full: Could this be the MOST beautiful part of Britain?

title: Could this be the MOST beautiful part of Britain?
text:
Could this be the MOST beautiful part of Britain? Could this be the MOST beautiful part of Britain? INCASE we needed any more proof Britain is one of the most beautiful countries in the world, these pictures have been released. PUBLISHED: 14:10, Mon, Oct 5, 2015 | UPDATED: 14:22, Mon, Oct 5, 2015 CATERS These gorgeous pictures were snapped as dawn broke over the Peak District 
You'd be forgiven for mistaking these snaps for a foreign climb - the deep mountains of France or Italy, perhaps. 
But the pictures were actually taken early on in the morning just outside Manchester. 
Photographer Calvin Taylor Lee, 38, from Sheffield took the photos on a foggy morning at Mam Tor in the Peak District. 
Speaking about his incredible shots, Calvin said: "I did know it was going to be that foggy, but I have never seen rolling fog like that before. 
"I am so glad I went out because it was a super sight to see, and to get to the top of the mountain to see it all was worth the trip up." CATERS The rolling clouds made this a sight to behold for the lucky photographer 
He added: "It was only my second time up to Mam Tor, but I love taking the pictures and am hoping to take more images that have this effect." 
Where Calvin was stood happens to be one of the biggest national parks in England - a real gem in the heart of Britain, 
The breath-taking views certainly shows the incredible natural beauty the country has to offer, with the winding roads beneath the district and the beautiful sunrise above the fog. 
Who needs to go abroad with views like this? CATERS Calvin was climbing up Mam Tor when he realised dawn was breaking CATERS Photographer Calvin Taylor Lee snapped these shots earlier this month Related articles
